level.heading: Action for possession of rental unit used as a drug haven.
Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary amendment of section, see § 2(b) of the Drug House Abatement Emergency Amendment Act of 1996 (D.C. Act 11-446, December 5, 1996, 43 DCR 6664).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 8-139
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 8-139, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 42-3631.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 11-176
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 11-176, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 42-3631.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 11-274
level.text: Law 11-274, the "Sex Offender Registration Act of 1996," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 11-386, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 7, 1996, and December 3, 1996, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 24, 1996, it was assigned Act No. 11-510 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-274 became effective on June 3, 1997.

level.heading: Expiration of law Expiration of Law 8-139
level.text: See Historical and Statutory Notes following § 42-3631.
